switches.name: AggressiveUnboxing

switches.name: AliasLevel
switches.description:
0 for no aliasing, 1 for oop/field/static/array split,
2 for class split, 3 for unique instances

switches.name: AlignVector
switches.description: Perform vector store/load alignment in loop

switches.name: AllocateHeapAt
switches.description: Path to the directoy where a temporary file will be created to use as the backing store for Java Heap.

switches.name: AllocateInstancePrefetchLines
switches.description: Number of lines to prefetch ahead of instance allocation pointer

switches.name: AllocateOldGenAt
switches.description: Path to the directoy where a temporary file will be created to use as the backing store for old generation.File of size Xmx is pre-allocated for performance reason, sowe need that much space available

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchDistance
switches.description: Distance to prefetch ahead of allocation pointer. -1: use system-specific value (automatically determined

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchInstr
switches.description: Select instruction to prefetch ahead of allocation pointer

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchLines
switches.description: Number of lines to prefetch ahead of array allocation pointer

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchStepSize
switches.description: Step size in bytes of sequential prefetch instructions

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchStyle
switches.description:
0 = no prefetch,
1 = generate prefetch instructions for each allocation,
2 = use TLAB watermark to gate allocation prefetch,
3 = generate one prefetch instruction per cache line

switches.name: AllowArchivingWithJavaAgent

switches.deprecation: Deprecated in JDK13

switches.name: AllowUserSignalHandlers
switches.description: Do not complain if the application installs signal handlers (Unix only)

switches.name: AllowVectorizeOnDemand
switches.description: Globally supress vectorization set in VectorizeMethod

switches.name: AlwaysActAsServerClassMachine
switches.description: Always act like a server-class machine

switches.name: AlwaysAtomicAccesses
switches.description: Accesses to all variables should always be atomic

switches.name: AlwaysCompileLoopMethods
switches.description: When using recompilation, never interpret methods containing loops

switches.name: AlwaysIncrementalInline
switches.description: do all inlining incrementally

switches.name: AlwaysLockClassLoader

Deprecated in JDK17
Obsoleted in JDK18

switches.name: AlwaysPreTouch
switches.description: Force all freshly committed pages to be pre-touched

switches.name: AlwaysRestoreFPU

switches.name: AlwaysSafeConstructors
switches.description: Force safe construction, as if all fields are final.

switches.name: AlwaysTenure
switches.description: Always tenure objects in eden (ParallelGC only)

switches.name: ArchiveClassesAtExit

switches.name: ArchiveRelocationMode
switches.description: (0) first map at preferred address, and if unsuccessful, map at alternative address (default); (1) always map at alternative address; (2) always map at preferred address, and if unsuccessful, do not map the archive

switches.name: ArrayAllocatorMallocLimit
switches.description: Allocation less than this value will be allocated using malloc. Larger allocations will use mmap.

switches.name: ArrayCopyLoadStoreMaxElem

switches.name: AutoBoxCacheMax

switches.name: AvoidUnalignedAccesses

switches.name: BCEATraceLevel

switches.name: BackgroundCompilation

Deprecated in JDK15

switches.name: BiasedLockingDecayTime

Deprecated in JDK15

switches.name: BootstrapJVMCI
switches.description: Bootstrap JVMCI before running Java main method. This initializes the compile queue with a small set of methods and processes the queue until it is empty. Combining this with -XX:-TieredCompilation makes JVMCI compile more of itself.

switches.name: CheckIntrinsics
switches.description: When a class C is loaded, check that (1) all intrinsics defined by the VM for class C are present in the loaded class file and are marked with the @HotSpotIntrinsicCandidate annotation, that (2) there is an intrinsic registered for all loaded methods that are annotated with the @HotSpotIntrinsicCandidate annotation, and that (3) no orphan methods exist for class C (i.e., methods for which the VM declares an intrinsic but that are not declared in the loaded class C. Check (3) is available only in debug builds.

switches.name: CompileCommandFile
switches.description: Read compiler commands from this file [.hotspot_compiler]

switches.defaultValue: List of methods (pkg/class.name) to restrict compilation to
switches.name: CompileOnly
CompileThresholdScaling
switches.description: Factor to control when first compilation happens (both with and without tiered compilation): values greater than 1.0 delay counter overflow, values between 0 and 1.0 rush counter overflow, value of 1.0 leaves compilation thresholds unchanged value of 0.0 is equivalent to -Xint. Flag can be set as per-method option. If a value is specified for a method, compilation thresholds for that method are scaled by both the value of the global flag and the value of the per-method flag.

switches.name: CompileThreshold
switches.description: number of interpreted method invocations before (re-)compiling

switches.description: Read compiler directives from this file

switches.description: Limit on number of compiler directives.

switches.name: EnableJVMCIProduct
switches.description: Allow JVMCI to be used in product mode. This alters a subset of JVMCI flags to be non-experimental, defaults UseJVMCICompiler and EnableJVMCI to true and defaults UseJVMCINativeLibrary to true if a JVMCI native library is available.

switches.name: EnableJVMCI
switches.description: Enable JVMCI

switches.name: EnableThreadSMRExtraValidityChecks
switches.description: Enable Thread SMR extra validity checks

switches.name: EnableThreadSMRStatistics
switches.description: Enable Thread SMR Statistics

switches.name: EpsilonElasticTLABDecay
switches.description: Use timed decays to shrik TLAB sizes. This conserves memory for the threads that allocate in bursts of different sizes, for example the small/rare allocations coming after the initial large burst.

switches.name: EpsilonElasticTLAB
switches.description: Use elastic policy to manage TLAB sizes. This conserves memory for non-actively allocating threads, even when they request large TLABs for themselves. Active threads would experience smaller TLABs until policy catches up.

switches.name: EpsilonMaxTLABSize
switches.description: Max TLAB size to use with Epsilon GC. Larger value improves performance at the expense of per-thread memory waste. This asks TLAB machinery to cap TLAB sizes at this value.

switches.name: EpsilonMinHeapExpand
switches.description: Min expansion step for heap. Larger value improves performance at the potential expense of memory waste.

switches.name: EpsilonPrintHeapSteps
switches.description:
Print heap occupancy stats with this number of steps.
0 turns the printing off.

switches.name: EpsilonTLABDecayTime
switches.description: TLAB sizing policy decays to initial size after thread had not allocated for this long. Time is in milliseconds. Lower value improves memory footprint, but penalizes actively allocating threads.

switches.name: EpsilonTLABElasticity
switches.description: Multiplier to use when deciding on next TLAB size. Larger value improves performance at the expense of per-thread memory waste. Lower value improves memory footprint, but penalizes actively allocating threads.

switches.description: Update heap occupancy counters after allocating this much memory. Higher values would make allocations faster at the expense of lower resolution in heap counters.

switches.name: ErgoHeapSizeLimit

switches.name: ErrorFileToStderr

switches.name: ErrorHandlerTest

switches.name: ErrorLogTimeout

switches.name: EscapeAnalysisTimeout

switches.description: The number of update buffers that are left in the queue by the concurrent processing threads. Will be selected ergonomically by default.

switches.name: G1ConcRefinementRedZone

switches.name: G1ConcRefinementServiceIntervalMillis
switches.description: The last concurrent refinement thread wakes up every specified number of milliseconds to do miscellaneous work.

switches.name: G1ConcRefinementThreads
switches.description: The number of parallel rem set update threads. Will be set ergonomically by default.

switches.name: G1ConcRefinementThresholdStep
switches.description: Each time the rset update queue increases by this amount activate the next refinement thread if available. The actual step size will be selected ergonomically by default, with this value used to determine a lower bound.

switches.name: G1ConcRefinementYellowZone
switches.description: Number of enqueued update buffers that will trigger concurrent processing. Will be selected ergonomically by default.

switches.name: G1ConfidencePercent
switches.description: Confidence level for MMU/pause predictions

switches.name: G1DummyRegionsPerGC

switches.name: G1EagerReclaimHumongousObjectsWithStaleRefs
switches.description: Try to reclaim dead large objects that have a few stale references at every young GC.

switches.name: G1EagerReclaimHumongousObjects
switches.description: Try to reclaim dead large objects at every young GC.

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALotCount

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALotDuringConcMark

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALotDuringInitialMark
switches.description: Force use of evacuation failure handling during initial mark evacuation pauses

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALotDuringMixedGC
switches.description: Force use of evacuation failure handling during mixed evacuation pauses

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALotDuringYoungGC
switches.description: Force use of evacuation failure handling during young evacuation pauses

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALotInterval
switches.description: Total collections between forced triggering of evacuation failures

switches.name: G1EvacuationFailureALot
switches.description: Force use of evacuation failure handling during certain evacuation pauses

switches.name: G1ExitOnExpansionFailure
switches.description: Raise a fatal VM exit out of memory failure in the event that heap expansion fails due to running out of swap.

switches.name: G1ExpandByPercentOfAvailable
switches.description: When expanding, % of uncommitted space to claim.

switches.name: G1HeapRegionSize
switches.description: Size of the G1 regions.

switches.name: G1HeapWastePercent
switches.description: Amount of space, expressed as a percentage of the heap size, that G1 is willing not to collect to avoid expensive GCs.

switches.name: G1LastPLABAverageOccupancy
switches.description: The expected average occupancy of the last PLAB in percent.

switches.name: G1MaxNewSizePercent
switches.description: Percentage (0-100) of the heap size to use as default maximum young gen size.

switches.name: G1MaxVerifyFailures
switches.description: The maximum number of verification failures to print. -1 means print all.

switches.name: G1MixedGCCountTarget
switches.description: The target number of mixed GCs after a marking cycle.

switches.name: G1MixedGCLiveThresholdPercent
switches.description: Threshold for regions to be considered for inclusion in the collection set of mixed GCs. Regions with live bytes exceeding this will not be collected.

switches.name: G1NewSizePercent
switches.description: Percentage (0-100) of the heap size to use as default minimum young gen size.

switches.name: G1OldCSetRegionThresholdPercent
switches.description: An upper bound for the number of old CSet regions expressed as a percentage of the heap size.

switches.name: G1PeriodicGCInterval
switches.description: Number of milliseconds after a previous GC to wait before triggering a periodic gc. A value of zero disables periodically enforced gc cycles.

switches.name: G1PeriodicGCInvokesConcurrent
switches.description: Determines the kind of periodic GC. Set to true to have G1 perform a concurrent GC as periodic GC, otherwise use a STW Full GC.

switches.name: G1PeriodicGCSystemLoadThreshold
switches.description: Maximum recent system wide load as returned by the 1m value of getloadavg() at which G1 triggers a periodic GC. A load above this value cancels a given periodic GC. A value of zero disables this check.

switches.name: G1RSetRegionEntriesBase
switches.description: Max number of regions in a fine-grain table per MB.

switches.name: G1RSetRegionEntries
switches.description: Max number of regions for which we keep bitmaps.Will be set ergonomically by default

switches.name: G1RSetSparseRegionEntriesBase
switches.description: Max number of entries per region in a sparse table per MB.

switches.name: G1RSetSparseRegionEntries
switches.description: Max number of entries per region in a sparse table.Will be set ergonomically by default.

switches.name: G1RSetUpdatingPauseTimePercent
switches.description: A target percentage of time that is allowed to be spend on process RS update buffers during the collection pause.

switches.name: G1RebuildRemSetChunkSize

switches.name: G1RefProcDrainInterval
switches.description: The number of discovered reference objects to process before draining concurrent marking work queues.

switches.name: G1ReservePercent
switches.description: It determines the minimum reserve we should have in the heap to minimize the probability of promotion failure.

switches.name: G1SATBBufferEnqueueingThresholdPercent
switches.description: Before enqueueing them, each mutator thread tries to do some filtering on the SATB buffers it generates. If post-filtering the percentage of retained entries is over this threshold the buffer will be enqueued for processing. A value of 0 specifies that mutator threads should not do such filtering.

switches.name: G1SATBBufferSize
switches.description: Number of entries in an SATB log buffer.

switches.name: G1SATBProcessCompletedThreshold
switches.description: Number of completed buffers that triggers log processing.

switches.name: G1SummarizeRSetStatsPeriod
switches.description: The period (in number of GCs) at which we will generate update buffer processing info (0 means do not periodically generate this info); it also requires that logging is enabled on the tracelevel for gc+remset

switches.name: G1UpdateBufferSize
switches.description: Size of an update buffer

switches.name: G1UseAdaptiveConcRefinement
switches.description: Select green, yellow and red zones adaptively to meet the the pause requirements.

switches.name: G1UseAdaptiveIHOP
switches.description: Adaptively adjust the initiating heap occupancy from the initial value of InitiatingHeapOccupancyPercent. The policy attempts to start marking in time based on application behavior.

switches.name: G1UseReferencePrecleaning
switches.description: Concurrently preclean java.lang.ref.references instances before the Remark pause.

switches.name: G1VerifyCTCleanup

To reduce these calls, we keep a buffer of extra regions to absorb small changes in young gen length. This flag takes the buffer size as an percentage of young gen length

switches.name: MarkSweepDeadRatio
switches.description: Percentage (0-100) of the old gen allowed as dead wood. Serial mark sweep treats this as both the minimum and maximum value. Par compact uses a variable scale based on the density of the generation and treats this as the maximum value when the heap is either completely full or completely empty. Par compact also has a smaller default value; see arguments.cpp.

switches.name: ProfileInterpreter

switches.name: ProfileMaturityPercentage

switches.name: ProfileTraps
switches.description: Profile deoptimization traps at the bytecode level

switches.name: ProfiledCodeHeapSize
switches.description: Size of code heap with profiled methods (in bytes)

switches.name: ProfilerNodeSize
switches.description: Size in K to allocate for the Profile Nodes of each thread

switches.name: PromotedPadding
switches.description: How much buffer to keep for promotion failure

switches.name: PromotionFailureALotCount
switches.description: Number of promotion failures occurring at PLAB promotion attempts at young collectors

switches.name: PromotionFailureALotInterval
switches.description: Total collections between promotion failures a lot

switches.name: PromotionFailureALot
switches.description: Use promotion failure handling on every youngest generation collection

switches.name: ProtectionDomainVerification
switches.description: Verify protection domain before resolution in system dictionary

switches.name: QueuedAllocationWarningCount
switches.description: Number of times an allocation that queues behind a GC will retry before printing a warning

switches.name: RTMAbortRatio
switches.description: Lock abort ratio at which to stop use RTM lock eliding

switches.name: RTMAbortRatio
switches.description: Lock abort ratio at which to stop use RTM lock eliding

switches.name: RTMAbortThreshold
switches.description: Calculate abort ratio after this number of aborts

switches.name: RTMAbortThreshold
switches.description: Calculate abort ratio after this number of aborts

switches.name: RTMLockingCalculationDelay
switches.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before start calculating aborts for RTM locking

switches.name: RTMLockingCalculationDelay
switches.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before start calculating aborts for RTM locking

switches.name: RTMLockingThreshold
switches.description: Lock count at which to do RTM lock eliding without abort ratio calculation

switches.name: RTMLockingThreshold
switches.description: Lock count at which to do RTM lock eliding without abort ratio calculation

switches.name: RTMRetryCount
switches.description: Number of RTM retries on lock abort or busy

switches.name: RTMRetryCount
switches.description: Number of RTM retries on lock abort or busy

switches.name: RTMSpinLoopCount
switches.description: Spin count for lock to become free before RTM retry
switches.range: range(0, 32767) /* immediate operand limit on ppc */

switches.name: RTMSpinLoopCount
switches.description: Spin count for lock to become free before RTM retry

switches.name: RTMTotalCountIncrRate
switches.description: Increment total RTM attempted lock count once every n times
switches.range: range(1, 32767) /* immediate operand limit on ppc */

switches.name: RTMTotalCountIncrRate
switches.description: Increment total RTM attempted lock count once every n times

switches.name: RangeCheckElimination
switches.description: Eliminate range checks

switches.name: ReassociateInvariants
switches.description: Enable reassociation of expressions with loop invariants.

switches.name: ReduceBulkZeroing
switches.description: When bulk-initializing, try to avoid needless zeroing

switches.name: ReduceFieldZeroing
switches.description: When initializing fields, try to avoid needless zeroing

switches.name: ReduceInitialCardMarks
switches.description: When initializing fields, try to avoid needless card marks

switches.name: ReduceNumberOfCompilerThreads
switches.description: Reduce the number of parallel compiler threads when they are not used

switches.name: ReduceSignalUsage
switches.description: Reduce the use of OS signals in Java and/or the VM

switches.name: RefDiscoveryPolicy
switches.description: Select type of reference discovery policy: reference-based(0) or referent-based(1)

switches.name: ReferencesPerThread
switches.description: Ergonomically start one thread for this amount of references for reference processing if ParallelRefProcEnabled is true. Specify 0 to disable and use all threads.

switches.name: RegisterCostAreaRatio
switches.description: Spill selection in reg allocator: scale area by (X/64K) before adding cost

switches.name: RegisterFinalizersAtInit
switches.description: Register finalizable objects at end of Object.<init> or after allocation

switches.name: RegisterReferences
switches.description: Tell whether the VM should register soft/weak/final/phantom references

switches.name: RelaxAccessControlCheck
switches.description: Relax the access control checks in the verifier

switches.name: RenumberLiveNodes
switches.description: Renumber live nodes

switches.name: ReoptimizeCallSequences
switches.description: Reoptimize code-sequences of calls at runtime.

switches.name: ReoptimizeCallSequences
switches.description: Reoptimize code-sequences of calls at runtime.

switches.name: ReplayCompiles
switches.description: Enable replay of compilations from ReplayDataFile

switches.name: ReplayDataFile
switches.description: File containing compilation replay information[default: ./replay_pid%p.log] (%p replaced with pid)

switches.name: ReplayIgnoreInitErrors
switches.description: Ignore exceptions thrown during initialization for replay

switches.name: ReplaySuppressInitializers
switches.description:
Control handling of class initialization during replay:
0 - don't do anything special;
1 - treat all class initializers as empty;
2 - treat class initializers for application classes as empty;
3 - allow all class initializers to run during bootstrap but pretend they are empty after starting replay

switches.name: RequireSharedSpaces
switches.description: Require shared spaces for metadata

switches.name: ReservedCodeCacheSize
switches.description: Reserved code cache size (in bytes) - maximum code cache size

switches.name: ResizePLAB
switches.description: Dynamically resize (survivor space) promotion LAB's

switches.name: ResizeTLAB
switches.description: Dynamically resize TLAB size for threads

switches.name: RestoreMXCSROnJNICalls
switches.description: Restore MXCSR when returning from JNI calls

switches.name: RestrictContended
switches.description: Restrict @Contended to trusted classes

switches.name: RestrictReservedStack
switches.description: Restrict @ReservedStackAccess to trusted classes

switches.name: RewriteBytecodes
switches.description: Allow rewriting of bytecodes (bytecodes are not immutable)

switches.name: RewriteFrequentPairs
switches.description: Rewrite frequently used bytecode pairs into a single bytecode

switches.name: SafepointALot
switches.description: Generate a lot of safepoints. This works with GuaranteedSafepointInterval

switches.name: SafepointTimeoutDelay
switches.description: Delay in milliseconds for option SafepointTimeout

switches.name: SafepointTimeout
switches.description: Time out and warn or fail after SafepointTimeoutDelay milliseconds if failed to reach safepoint

switches.name: ScavengeALotInterval
switches.description: Interval between which scavenge will occur with +ScavengeALot

switches.name: ScavengeALot
switches.description: Force scavenge at every Nth exit from the runtime system (N=ScavengeALotInterval)

switches.name: ScavengeBeforeFullGC
switches.description: Scavenge youngest generation before each full GC.

switches.name: ScavengeRootsInCode
switches.description:
0: do not allow scavengable oops in the code cache;
1: allow scavenging from the code cache;
2: emit as many constants as the compiler can see

switches.name: SegmentedCodeCache
switches.description: Use a segmented code cache

switches.name: SelectivePhiFunctions
switches.description: create phi functions at loop headers only when necessary

switches.name: SelfDestructTimer
switches.description: Will cause VM to terminate after a given time (in minutes) (0 means off)

switches.name: SerializeVMOutput
switches.description: Use a mutex to serialize output to tty and LogFile

switches.name: SharedArchiveConfigFile
switches.description: Data to add to the CDS archive file

switches.name: SharedArchiveFile
switches.description: Override the default location of the CDS archive file

switches.name: SharedBaseAddress
switches.description: Address to allocate shared memory region for class data

switches.name: SharedClassListFile
switches.description: Override the default CDS class list

switches.name: SharedSymbolTableBucketSize
switches.description: Average number of symbols per bucket in shared table

switches.name: ShenandoahAllocFailureALot
switches.description: Testing: make lots of artificial allocation failures.

switches.name: ShenandoahAllocSpikeFactor
switches.description: How much of heap should some heuristics reserve for absorbing the allocation spikes. Larger value wastes more memory in non-emergency cases, but provides more safety in emergency cases. In percents of (soft) max heap size.

switches.name: ShenandoahAllocationThreshold
switches.description: How many new allocations should happen since the last GC cycle before some heuristics trigger the collection. In percents of (soft) max heap size. Set to zero to effectively disable.

switches.name: ShenandoahAlwaysClearSoftRefs
switches.description: Unconditionally clear soft references, instead of using any other cleanup policy. This minimizes footprint at expense ofmore soft reference churn in applications.

switches.name: ShenandoahCASBarrier
switches.description: Turn on/off CAS barriers in Shenandoah

switches.name: ShenandoahCloneBarrier
switches.description: Turn on/off clone barriers in Shenandoah

switches.name: ShenandoahCodeRootsStyle
switches.description: Use this style to scan the code cache roots: 0 - sequential iterator; 1 - parallel iterator; 2 - parallel iterator with cset filters;

switches.name: ShenandoahControlIntervalAdjustPeriod
switches.description: The time period for one step in control loop interval adjustment. Lower values make adjustments faster, at the expense of higher perf overhead. Time is in milliseconds.

switches.name: ShenandoahControlIntervalMax
switches.description: The maximum sleep interval for control loop that drives the cycles. Lower values would increase GC responsiveness to changing heap conditions, at the expense of higher perf overhead. Time is in milliseconds.

switches.name: ShenandoahControlIntervalMin
switches.description: The minimum sleep interval for the control loop that drives the cycles. Lower values would increase GC responsiveness to changing heap conditions, at the expense of higher perf overhead. Time is in milliseconds.

switches.name: ShenandoahCriticalFreeThreshold
switches.description: How much of the heap needs to be free after recovery cycles, either Degenerated or Full GC to be claimed successful. If this much space is not available, next recovery step would be triggered.

switches.name: ShenandoahDegeneratedGC
switches.description: Enable Degenerated GC as the graceful degradation step. Disabling this option leads to degradation to Full GC instead. When running in passive mode, this can be toggled to measure either Degenerated GC or Full GC costs.

switches.name: ShenandoahElasticTLAB
switches.description: Use Elastic TLABs with Shenandoah

switches.name: ShenandoahEvacReserveOverflow
switches.description: Allow evacuations to overflow the reserved space. Enabling it will make evacuations more resilient when evacuation reserve/waste is incorrect, at the risk that application runs out of memory too early.

switches.name: ShenandoahEvacReserve
switches.description: How much of heap to reserve for evacuations. Larger values make GC evacuate more live objects on every cycle, while leaving less headroom for application to allocate in. In percents of total heap size.

switches.name: ShenandoahEvacWaste
switches.description: How much waste evacuations produce within the reserved space. Larger values make evacuations more resilient against evacuation conflicts, at expense of evacuating less on each GC cycle.

switches.name: ShenandoahFullGCThreshold
switches.description: How many back-to-back Degenerated GCs should happen before going to a Full GC.

switches.name: ShenandoahGCHeuristics
switches.description: GC heuristics to use. This fine-tunes the GC mode selected, by choosing when to start the GC, how much to process on each cycle, and what other features to automatically enable. Possible values are: adaptive - adapt to maintain the given amount of free heap at all times, even during the GC cycle; static - trigger GC when free heap falls below the threshold; aggressive - run GC continuously, try to evacuate everything; compact - run GC more frequently and with deeper targets to free up more memory.

switches.name: ShenandoahGCMode
switches.description: GC mode to use. Among other things, this defines which barriers are in in use. Possible values are: satb - snapshot-at-the-beginning concurrent GC (three pass mark-evac-update); iu - incremental-update concurrent GC (three pass mark-evac-update); passive - stop the world GC only (either degenerated or full)

switches.name: ShenandoahGarbageThreshold
switches.description: How much garbage a region has to contain before it would be taken for collection. This a guideline only, as GC heuristics may select the region for collection even if it has little garbage. This also affects how much internal fragmentation the collector accepts. In percents of heap region size.

switches.name: ShenandoahGuaranteedGCInterval
switches.description: Many heuristics would guarantee a concurrent GC cycle at least with this interval. This is useful when large idle intervals are present, where GC can run without stealing time from active application. Time is in milliseconds. Setting this to 0 disables the feature.

switches.name: ShenandoahHumongousMoves
switches.description: Allow moving humongous regions. This makes GC more resistant to external fragmentation that may otherwise fail other humongous allocations, at the expense of higher GC copying costs. Currently affects stop-the-world (Full) cycle only.

switches.name: ShenandoahHumongousThreshold
switches.description: Humongous objects are allocated in separate regions. This setting defines how large the object should be to be deemed humongous. Value is in percents of heap region size. This also caps the maximum TLAB size.

switches.name: ShenandoahImmediateThreshold
switches.description: The cycle may shortcut when enough garbage can be reclaimed from the immediate garbage (completely garbage regions). In percents of total garbage found. Setting this threshold to 100 effectively disables the shortcut.

switches.name: ShenandoahImplicitGCInvokesConcurrent
switches.description: Should internally-caused GC requests invoke concurrent cycles, should they do the stop-the-world (Degenerated / Full GC)? Many heuristics automatically enable this. This option is similar to global ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent.

switches.name: ShenandoahInitFreeThreshold
switches.description: How much heap should be free before some heuristics trigger the initial (learning) cycles. Affects cycle frequency on startup and after drastic state changes, e.g. after degenerated/full GC cycles. In percents of (soft) max heap size.

switches.name: ShenandoahLearningSteps
switches.description: The number of cycles some heuristics take to collect in order to learn application and GC performance.

switches.name: ShenandoahLoadRefBarrier
switches.description: Turn on/off load-reference barriers in Shenandoah

switches.name: ShenandoahLoopOptsAfterExpansion
switches.description: Attempt more loop opts after barrier expansion.

switches.name: ShenandoahMarkLoopStride
switches.description: How many items to process during one marking iteration before checking for cancellation, yielding, etc. Larger values improve marking performance at expense of responsiveness.

switches.name: ShenandoahMarkScanPrefetch
switches.description: How many objects to prefetch ahead when traversing mark bitmaps.Set to 0 to disable prefetching.

switches.name: ShenandoahMaxRegionSize
switches.description: With automatic region sizing, the regions would be at most this large.

switches.name: ShenandoahMinFreeThreshold
switches.description: How much heap should be free before most heuristics trigger the collection, even without other triggers. Provides the safety margin for many heuristics. In percents of (soft) max heap size.

switches.name: ShenandoahMinRegionSize
switches.description: With automatic region sizing, the regions would be at least this large.

switches.name: ShenandoahOOMDuringEvacALot
switches.description: Testing: simulate OOM during evacuation.

switches.name: ShenandoahPacingCycleSlack
switches.description: How much of free space to take as non-taxable allocations the GC cycle. Larger value makes the pacing milder at the beginning of the GC cycle. Lower value makes the pacing less uniform during the cycle. In percent of free space.

switches.name: ShenandoahPacingIdleSlack
switches.description: How much of heap counted as non-taxable allocations during idle phases. Larger value makes the pacing milder when collector is idle, requiring less rendezvous with control thread. Lower value makes the pacing control less responsive to out-of-cycle allocs. In percent of total heap size.

switches.name: ShenandoahPacingMaxDelay
switches.description: Max delay for pacing application allocations. Larger values provide more resilience against out of memory, at expense at hiding the GC latencies in the allocation path. Time is in milliseconds. Setting it to arbitrarily large value makes GC effectively stall the threads indefinitely instead of going to degenerated or Full GC.

switches.name: ShenandoahPacingSurcharge
switches.description: Additional pacing tax surcharge to help unclutter the heap. Larger values makes the pacing more aggressive. Lower values risk GC cycles finish with less memory than were available at the beginning of it.

switches.name: ShenandoahPacing
switches.description: Pace application allocations to give GC chance to start and complete before allocation failure is reached.

switches.name: ShenandoahParallelRegionStride
switches.description: How many regions to process at once during parallel region iteration. Affects heaps with lots of regions.

switches.name: ShenandoahPreclean
switches.description: Do concurrent preclean phase before final mark: process definitely alive references to avoid dealing with them during pause.

switches.name: ShenandoahRefProcFrequency
switches.description: Process process weak (soft, phantom, finalizers) references every Nth cycle. Normally affects concurrent GC cycles only, as degenerated and full GCs would try to process references regardless. Set to zero to disable reference processing completely.

switches.name: ShenandoahRegionSamplingRate
switches.description: Sampling rate for heap region sampling. In milliseconds between the samples. Higher values provide more fidelity, at expense of more sampling overhead.

switches.name: ShenandoahRegionSampling
switches.description: Provide heap region sampling data via jvmstat.

switches.name: ShenandoahRegionSize
switches.description: Static heap region size. Set zero to enable automatic sizing.

switches.name: ShenandoahSATBBarrier
switches.description: Turn on/off SATB barriers in Shenandoah

switches.name: ShenandoahSATBBufferFlushInterval
switches.description: Forcefully flush non-empty SATB buffers at this interval. Time is in milliseconds.

switches.name: ShenandoahSATBBufferSize
switches.description: Number of entries in an SATB log buffer.

switches.name: ShenandoahSelfFixing
switches.description: Fix references with load reference barrier. Disabling this might degrade performance.

switches.name: ShenandoahStoreValEnqueueBarrier
switches.description: Turn on/off enqueuing of oops for storeval barriers

switches.name: ShenandoahSuspendibleWorkers
switches.description: Suspend concurrent GC worker threads at safepoints

switches.name: ShenandoahTargetNumRegions
switches.description: With automatic region sizing, this is the approximate number of regions that would be used, within min/max region size limits.

switches.name: ShenandoahUncommitDelay
switches.description: Uncommit memory for regions that were not used for more than this time. First use after that would incur allocation stalls. Actively used regions would never be uncommitted, because they do not become unused longer than this delay. Time is in milliseconds. Setting this delay to 0 effectively uncommits regions almost immediately after they become unused.

switches.name: ShenandoahUncommit
switches.description: Allow to uncommit memory under unused regions and metadata. This optimizes footprint at expense of allocation latency in regions that require committing back. Uncommits would be disabled by some heuristics, or with static heap size.

switches.name: ShenandoahUnloadClassesFrequency
switches.description: Unload the classes every Nth cycle. Normally affects concurrent GC cycles, as degenerated and full GCs would try to unload classes regardless. Set to zero to disable class unloading.

switches.name: ShenandoahVerifyLevel
switches.description: Verification level, higher levels check more, taking more time. Accepted values are: 0 = basic heap checks; 1 = previous level, plus basic region checks; 2 = previous level, plus all roots; 3 = previous level, plus all reachable objects; 4 = previous level, plus all marked objects

switches.name: ShenandoahVerifyOptoBarriers
switches.description: Verify no missing barriers in C2.

switches.name: ShenandoahVerify
switches.description: Enable internal verification. This would catch many GC bugs, but it would also stall the collector during the verification, which prolongs the pauses and might hide other bugs.

switches.name: ShowCodeDetailsInExceptionMessages
switches.description: Show exception messages from RuntimeExceptions that contain snippets of the failing code. Disable this to improve privacy.

switches.name: ShowHiddenFrames
switches.description: show method handle implementation frames (usually hidden)

switches.name: ShowMessageBoxOnError
switches.description: Keep process alive on VM fatal error

switches.name: ShowRegistersOnAssert
switches.description: On internal errors, include registers in error report.

switches.name: ShrinkHeapInSteps
switches.description: When disabled, informs the GC to shrink the java heap directly to the target size at the next full GC rather than requiring smaller steps during multiple full GCs.

switches.name: SoftMatchFailure
switches.description: If the DFA fails to match a node, print a message and bail out

switches.name: SoftMaxHeapSize
switches.description: Soft limit for maximum heap size (in bytes)

switches.name: SoftRefLRUPolicyMSPerMB
switches.description: Number of milliseconds per MB of free space in the heap

switches.name: SoftwarePrefetchHintDistance
switches.description: Use prfm hint with specified distance in compiled code.Value -1 means off.

switches.name: SpecTrapLimitExtraEntries
switches.description: Extra method data trap entries for speculation

switches.name: SpecialArraysEquals
switches.description: special version of Arrays.equals(char[],char[])

switches.name: SpecialEncodeISOArray
switches.description: special version of ISO_8859_1$Encoder.encodeISOArray

switches.name: SpecialStringCompareTo
switches.description: special version of string compareTo

switches.name: SpecialStringEquals
switches.description: special version of string equals

switches.name: SpecialStringIndexOf
switches.description: special version of string indexOf

switches.name: SplitIfBlocks
switches.description: Clone compares and control flow through merge points to fold some branches

switches.name: StackPrintLimit
switches.description: number of stack frames to print in VM-level stack dump

switches.name: StackRedPages
switches.description:
Number of red zone (unrecoverable overflows) pages of size
4KB. If pages are bigger red zone is aligned up.

switches.name: StackReservedPages
switches.description: Number of reserved zone (reserved to annotated methods) pages of size 4KB. If pages are bigger reserved zone is aligned up.

switches.name: StackShadowPages
switches.description:
Number of shadow zone (for overflow checking) pages of size
4KB. If pages are bigger shadow zone is aligned up. This should exceed the depth of the VM and native call stack.

switches.name: StackTraceInThrowable
switches.description: Collect backtrace in throwable when exception happens

switches.name: StackYellowPages
switches.description:
Number of yellow zone (recoverable overflows) pages of size
4KB. If pages are bigger yellow zone is aligned up.

switches.name: StartAggressiveSweepingAt
switches.description: Start aggressive sweeping if X[%] of the code cache is free.Segmented code cache: X[%] of the non-profiled heap.Non-segmented code cache: X[%] of the total code cache

switches.name: StartAttachListener
switches.description: Always start Attach Listener at VM startup

switches.name: StartFlightRecording
switches.description: Start flight recording with options

switches.name: StopInterpreterAt
switches.description: Stop interpreter execution at specified bytecode number

switches.name: StressArrayCopyMacroNode
switches.description: Perform ArrayCopy load/store replacement during IGVN only

switches.name: StressCodeAging
switches.description: Start with counters compiled in

switches.name: StressCodeBuffers
switches.description: Exercise code buffer expansion and other rare state changes

switches.name: StressCompiledExceptionHandlers
switches.description: Exercise compiled exception handlers

switches.name: StressCriticalJNINatives
switches.description: Exercise register saving code in critical natives

switches.name: StressDerivedPointers
switches.description: Force scavenge when a derived pointer is detected on stack after rtm call

switches.name: StressGCM
switches.description: Randomize instruction scheduling in GCM

switches.name: StressLCM
switches.description: Randomize instruction scheduling in LCM

switches.name: StressLdcRewrite
switches.description: Force ldc -> ldc_w rewrite during RedefineClasses

switches.name: StressLinearScan
switches.description: scramble block order used by LinearScan (stress test)

switches.name: StressLoopInvariantCodeMotion
switches.description: stress loop invariant code motion

switches.name: StressMethodHandleLinkerInlining
switches.description: Stress inlining through method handle linkers

switches.name: StressRangeCheckElimination
switches.description: stress Range Check Elimination

switches.name: StressRecompilation
switches.description: Recompile each compiled method without subsuming loads or escape analysis.

switches.name: StressReflectiveCode
switches.description: Use inexact types at allocations, etc., to test reflection

switches.name: StressRewriter
switches.description: Stress linktime bytecode rewriting

switches.name: StringDeduplicationAgeThreshold
switches.description: A string must reach this age (or be promoted to an old region) to be considered for deduplication

switches.name: StringDeduplicationRehashALot
switches.description: Force table rehash every time the table is scanned

switches.name: StringDeduplicationResizeALot
switches.description: Force table resize every time the table is scanned

switches.name: StringTableSize
switches.description: Number of buckets in the interned String table (will be rounded to nearest higher power of 2)

switches.name: SubsumeLoads
switches.description: Attempt to compile while subsuming loads into machine instructions.

switches.name: SuperWordLoopUnrollAnalysis
switches.description: Map number of unrolls for main loop via Superword Level Parallelism analysis

switches.name: SuperWordRTDepCheck
switches.description: Enable runtime dependency checks.

switches.name: SuperWordReductions
switches.description: Enable reductions support in superword.

switches.name: SuperwordUseVSX
switches.description: Use Power8 VSX instructions for superword optimization.

switches.name: SuppressFatalErrorMessage
switches.description: Report NO fatal error message (avoid deadlock)

switches.name: SurvivorAlignmentInBytes
switches.description: Default survivor space alignment in bytes

switches.name: SurvivorPadding
switches.description: How much buffer to keep for survivor overflow

switches.name: SurvivorRatio
switches.description: Ratio of eden/survivor space size

switches.name: SuspendRetryCount
switches.description: Maximum retry count for an external suspend request

switches.name: SuspendRetryDelay
switches.description: Milliseconds to delay per retry (* current_retry_count)

switches.name: SweeperLogEntries
switches.description: Number of records in the ring buffer of sweeper activity

switches.name: SweeperThreshold
switches.description: Threshold controlling when code cache sweeper is invoked.Value is percentage of ReservedCodeCacheSize.

switches.name: SymbolTableSize
switches.description: Number of buckets in the JVM internal Symbol table

switches.name: TLABAllocationWeight

switches.name: ThreadPriorityPolicy
switches.description:
0 : Normal. VM chooses priorities that are appropriate for normal applications. On Windows applications are allowed to use higher native priorities. However, with ThreadPriorityPolicy=0, VM will not use the highest possible native priority, THREAD_PRIORITY_TIME_CRITICAL, as it may interfere with system threads. On Linux thread priorities are ignored because the OS does not support static priority in SCHED_OTHER scheduling class which is the only choice for non-root, non-realtime applications.
1 : Aggressive. Java thread priorities map over to the entire range of native thread priorities. Higher Java thread priorities map to higher native thread priorities. This policy should be used with care, as sometimes it can cause performance degradation in the application and/or the entire system. On Linux/BSD/macOS this policy requires root privilege or an extended capability.
